definition: to drool with desire (idiom); to envy/to hunger for
to hang (down)/droop/dangle/bend down/hand down/bequeath/nearly/almost/to approach
saliva
to wish for/to desire/variant of 慾|欲[yu4]
a drop/to drip

sentences.english: My mouth often watered at the sight of choclate in the window.
sentences.chinese: 我一看到櫥窗裏的巧克力就垂涎欲滴。

sentences.english: They all but drooled over it.
This allows a lot of men more lick one's chaps .
sentences.chinese: 這讓很多男人更加垂涎欲滴。

sentences.english: Breeze slowly sent aromas of peach intoxicate, let a person be salivating.
sentences.chinese: 輕風徐徐送來蜜桃醉人的芳香，讓人垂涎欲滴。

sentences.english: The dealer was slavering over some precious stones.
sentences.chinese: 經銷商對一些寶石垂涎欲滴。

sentences.english: Dumpling and white circle, look to drool.
sentences.chinese: 湯圓又白又圓，看起來使人垂涎欲滴。

sentences.english: At the sight of the food he started drooling.
sentences.chinese: 他一看到那些食物便垂涎欲滴。

sentences.english: She smacked her lips over the rich dessert set before her.
sentences.chinese: 她對擺在面前的豐盛甜點心，垂涎欲滴。

sentences.english: You could compare it to the best-¬tasting oatmeal they'd ever eaten, and their mouths might water.
sentences.chinese: 你可以拿它和最美味的麥片相比，他們準會垂涎欲滴。
